ygData.subject: Re: analysing progress-statistics.log
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Gordon, sorry about following up almost after a month on this. Your analysis is quite true. The queued URIs are from a host that is sometimes slow.

Hi Gordon,

sorry about following up almost after a month on this.

Your a=
nalysis is quite true. The 'queued' URIs are from a host that is sometimes =
slow. However the host is not totally non-responding.

I am targeting only =
1 site and somewhere in the middle the crawl 'SNOOZES' forever! I have chan=
ged the retryDelaySeconds to 180
and maxRetries to 3. 
Here is the snoozed =
queue details.

-----=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D SNOOZED QUEUES =3D=3D=3D=3D=3D-----
SN=
OOZED#0:
Queue com,freep,www, (p1)
  8583 items
   wakes in: 1m22s228ms
   =
 last enqueued: http://www.freep.com/article/20091115/NEWS02/911150518/1004=
/news02/Signatures-OKd-on-petitions-to-oust-4-officials-in-Van-Buren-Townsh=
ip- 
      last peeked: http://www.freep.com/article/20091115/NEWS02/911150=
518/1004/news02/Signatures-OKd-on-petitions-to-oust-4-officials-in-Van-Bure=
n-Township-
   total expended: 5424 (total budget: -1)
   active balance: -=
2424
   last(avg) cost: 1(1)
----------------------------------------

My q=
uestions are:
1)The server is definitely responsive but little too slow. Is=
 there a way I can increase the server_response_wait time to 2 or 3 minutes=
 so that Heritrix spends little more time tying to fetch it? Or can I force=
 bypass the URI creating blockage at the queue front?

2)I read the frontie=
r queue budgeting https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Frontie=
r+queue+budgets 
I am not sure if I understood the concept. Why my active b=
alance is -2424? I read ...when the balance goes non-positive, the queue is=
 again deactivated...

Thanks for any insights!

Regards,
Pranay
--- In arc=
hive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> The 'queu=
ed' URIs are almost certainly on some hosts that are not 
> responding. Her=
itrix is trying them every 15 minutes, but then putting 
> them back on the=
 queue for another retry, until the default retry-count 
> of 30 is reached=
.
> 
> Look at the 'frontier report' for more info on the queues affected. =

> (Those in a slow retry due to a non-responsive server will usually show =

> up as being 'snoozed' for periods of minutes rather than the usual 
> nu=
mber of seconds.)
> 
> The 'dumpPendingAtClose' frontier setting *should* c=
ause all URIs not 
> crawled to be dumped to the crawl.log if a crawl finis=
hes cleanly with 
> URIs left over. (Though, it hasn't been tested yet in H=
3.)
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> Pranay Pandey wrote:
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > Hi,
> >=
 
> > I had set up a crawl job to run for 6 hours using H3-beta. I had it 
=
> > configured to be least polite and number of parallel queue was set to 5=
. 
> > After completion, when I looked at the avg download rate (docs/sec),=
 it 
> > was 0.9 docs/sec. Some of the targeted contents were not archived.=

> > 
> > Tracking down the reason for low download rate, I noticed that fo=
r 
> > almost 4 out of 6 hours , the download rate was showing up 0. Here a=
re 
> > some of the lines of the progress-statistics.log files:
> >

ter an hour of start:

   15071

 134688

ter ~2 hours:

> >

tion:

=
> > 168896            1           0           2

> > As can been seen, =
for about 4 hours, the number of URIs queued up stayed 
> > stagnant at 350=
. What could be causing this? Some of the contents well 
> > within the sco=
pe were not crawled. Is there a way I can access the 
> > 'queued' URIs?
